thread.title_full: Cricket-Australia set Pakistan victory target of 317 in second test | Sports-Games

author: Reuters
title: Cricket-Australia set Pakistan victory target of 317 in second test | Sports-Games
text: Cricket-Australia set Pakistan victory target of 317 in second test Pakistan made 264 in their first innings and will be up against it chasing down the target given the form of Pat Cummins and the Australian pace attack. The tourists were dismissed for 89 in the fourth innings as Australia won the first test in the three-match series by 360 runs in Perth two weeks ago. [Reuters](/reuters-stories)| Melbourne | Updated: 29-12-2023 06:43 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 06:43 IST - Country: - Australia Pakistan were set an imposing victory target of 317 runs on the fourth day of the second test on Friday after bowling Australia out for 262 before lunch. Australia had recovered from 16 for four after lunch on Thursday to resume on 187-6 on a sunny morning at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). Alex Carey scored his sixth test half century with a knock of 52 to help extend the lead before he was trapped leg before by seamer Mir Hamza (4-32) to bring an end to the innings. Pakistan made 264 in their first innings and will be up against it chasing down the target given the form of Pat Cummins and the Australian pace attack. The tourists were dismissed for 89 in the fourth innings as Australia won the first test in the three-match series by 360 runs in Perth two weeks ago. The highest successful fourth-innings run chase at the MCG was the 332 England scored back in 1928-29. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) - READ MORE ON: - [Pat Cummins](/news?tag=Pat+Cummins) - [Perth](/news?tag=Perth) - [Australia](/news?tag=Australia) - [Mir Hamza](/news?tag=Mir+Hamza) - [Pakistan](/news?tag=Pakistan) - [Australian](/news?tag=Australian) - [Alex Carey](/news?tag=Alex+Carey) - [England](/news?tag=England) ALSO READ [Australian woman jailed for 20 years for death of her four children has conviction quashed](/article/law-order/2745253-australian-woman-jailed-for-20-years-for-death-of-her-four-children-has-conviction-quashed) [Greenpeace Australia files greenwashing lawsuit against Woodside Energy](/article/headlines/2745264-greenpeace-australia-files-greenwashing-lawsuit-against-woodside-energy) [Australia win toss, opt to bat against Pakistan in 1st Test](/article/sports-games/2745321-australia-win-toss-opt-to-bat-against-pakistan-in-1st-test) [Pakistan: Imran Khan's pre-arrest bail dismissed in Toshakhana case](/article/international/2745309-pakistan-imran-khans-pre-arrest-bail-dismissed-in-toshakhana-case) [Australian woman jailed for 20 years for death of her four children has conviction quashed](/article/law-order/2745289-australian-woman-jailed-for-20-years-for-death-of-her-four-children-has-conviction-quashed)
